ca.uqac.lif.cep.tmf

Class Sink

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.cep.Processor
      • ca.uqac.lif.cep.SingleProcessor
        • ca.uqac.lif.cep.tmf.Sink
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Contextualizable, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileWriter, Print, QueueSink, SinkLast

    public abstract class Sink
extends SingleProcessor
    Receives input events and stores them. As its name implies, the Sink is just that: the end of a pipe of processors where events are input, but which has no output. In other words, a sink is a processor with an output arity of 0.

    When operating in "pull" mode, it is nevertheless possible to ask the sink to pull on its inputs; this is why, like a Pullable, it implements methods pull() and pullHard().

    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©
